tes_counts module¶

Given the thresholds, counts the number of photons and determine coincidence counts.

functions:

count_leo coincidence window threshold_masks

class tes_counts.Counts(count, uncorrelated, vacuum, has_noise_threshold)¶

Bases: tuple

Alias for field number 3

Alias for field number 1

Alias for field number 2

tes_counts.Povm¶

alias of tes_counts.povm

tes_counts.coincidence(abs_time, mask, low, high)¶

Find coincidences between two channels returning indices of partner events.

abs_timendarray

Array where each entry corresponds to the time where the detection was performed with respect to an initial time t0. This array can be constructed using np.cumsum(CaptureData(datapath).times).

maskndarray bool

Identifies the channels in abs_time. For abs_times where mask is False, time t is coincident if abs_time+low <= t <= abs_time+high. If the mask is True t is coincident if abs_time-high <= t <= abs_time-low.

lowfloat

The starting of the coincidence window.

highfloat

The ending side of the coincidence window.

coincidences(coinc, coinc_mask)tuple
coincndarray

Indexes of the coincident event in the other channel. When more than one event is found in the window the negated value of the first index is entered.

coinc_maskndarray bool

Indicates where exactly one event was found in the window.

Requires: window

tes_counts.count_leo(data, measurement_model, vacuum=False, has_noise_threshold=False, coinc_mask=None, herald_mask=None)¶

Give the number of counts for each number of photons.

datandarray

Measured data.

measurement_modelMixtureModel

Output from expectation_maximisation function. Refer to it to further details.

vacuumbool

Estimate vacuum terms using coinc_mask and herald_mask

coinc_maskndarray bool

Mask indicating coincidence counts.

herald_maskndarray bool

Mask indicating which events are in the heralding channel.

has_noise_thresholdbool

if True model.thresholds[1] represents the boundary between noise and 1 photon.

Counts(count, uncorrelated, vacuum)named tuple
countndarray

Counts for each photon number

uncorrelated :

Counts events not correlated with herald. Only calculated when coinc_mask and herald_mask are provided.

vacuum :

indicates if count[0] contains vacuum count

tes_counts.threshold_masks(data, model)¶
Parameters

  • data –

  • model –

Returns

tes_counts.window(ind, abs_time, low, high)¶

Get offsets from the current index ind in abs_time that are in the relative time window defined by low and high.

indint

Current index for abs_time.

abs_timendarray

Absolute times.

lowfloat

Starting point of the relative window.

highfloat

Ending point of the relative window.

(low_index, high_index)tuple

coincident times are abs_time[low_index:ind+high_index]
